@1@ Public member function, calls the member function {{tt|do_curr_symbol}} of the most derived class.

@2@ Returns the string used as the currency identifier by this locale. If {{tt|International}} (the second template parameter of {{tt|std::moneypunct}}) is {{c|false}}, the identifier is usually a single (wide) character, such as {{c|"￥"}} or {{c|"$"}}. If {{tt|International}} is {{c|true}}, the identifier is usually a four-character string holding the three-character {{enwiki|ISO 4217}} currency code followed by a space ({{c|"JPY "}} or {{c|"USD "}}).

===Return value===
The object of type {{tt|string_type}} holding the currency symbol or code.

===Example===
{{example
| 
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;locale&gt;

void show_ccy(const char* locname)
{
    std::locale loc(locname);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; locname &lt;&lt; " currency symbol is "
              &lt;&lt; std::use_facet&lt;std::moneypunct&lt;char, true&gt;&gt;(loc).curr_symbol()
              &lt;&lt; "or " &lt;&lt; std::use_facet&lt;std::moneypunct&lt;char&gt;&gt;(loc).curr_symbol()
              &lt;&lt; " for short\n";
}

int main()
{
    show_ccy("en_US.utf8");
    show_ccy("ja_JP.utf8");
    show_ccy("sv_SE.utf8");
    show_ccy("ru_RU.utf8");
    show_ccy("vi_VN.utf8");
}
|output=
en_US.utf8 currency symbol is USD or $ for short
ja_JP.utf8 currency symbol is JPY or ￥ for short
sv_SE.utf8 currency symbol is SEK or kr for short
ru_RU.utf8 currency symbol is RUB or руб for short
vi_VN.utf8 currency symbol is VND or ₫ for short
}}
